data.title: VS Code allows to open *.asar file from the command line
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.3.0
- OS Version: Windows 10

Open an *.asar file with VS Code from the command line.
It shows up as an empty project folder and trying to create a file there runs into errors:
![2016-07-04_12-10-24](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1898161/16560188/1476fff4-41f2-11e6-9ff5-503d39fd7909.png)

Trying to delete the *.asar from outside of VS Code results in this:
![2016-07-04_14-14-04](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1898161/16560113/92cba95a-41f1-11e6-9a80-9f5adf5bdce5.png)

Close the *.asar in VS Code and open another folder.
Trying to delete the *.asar from outside of VS Code still results in the same problem.

data.title: VS Code intellisense does not suggest members of js object.
data.body:
- VSCode Version:1.3.0 - insider
- OS Version: windows 7 enterprise

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Create a simple object like var person = { name = "foo" , age = 24 };
2. write person. (type dot). Nothing happens. Press ctrl + space, it shows no suggestion.

I just want to know is this the desired behavior ? I have tried the same thing in brackets and it works perfectly fine.
![vscode-code-suggestion-not-working](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7105293/16559914/c8b2d11c-420d-11e6-938c-6960a8fb5d4b.png)

data.title: can vscode run in a browser window ?
data.body: I was wanting to put vscode into a docker container, but would obviously need to be able to run vscode in a browser window - is this possible ?

data.title: Syntax highlighting gets confused if return type ends with a number
Closing a file without saving is not cleaning markers
data.body:
Steps to reproduce:
- Auto save is disabled
-  Open a typescript file
-  Make a change to cause an error in that file
- Close the file **without** saving

Expected: Markers should be cleared
Actual: Markers remain

![jul-04-2016 12-55-32](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10746682/16558553/c042124e-41e6-11e6-9ee5-ba47adf029bc.gif)

data.title: Show Explorer count and File editors in sync with save/do not save action

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- Create new files and edit them
- Use close all
- You get dialog per dirty editor for save confirmation
- Select do not save in first dialog

Observe that Explorer count and dirty editor on the background still does not reflect the state. They are updated only after all dialogs are confirmed. It would be nice if they can be in sync.

data.title: No ANSI output from 'tsc --pretty' task

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.2.1
- OS Version: Mac OS X El Capitan 10.11.5

Steps to Reproduce:
1.  tasks.json

```
{
    "version": "0.1.0",
    "command": "tsc",
    "isShellCommand": true,
    "args": ["--pretty"],
    "problemMatcher": "$tsc"
}
```
1. test.ts

```
dummy;
```
1. ctrl+p task tsc

```
[100;30m1 dummy;
[100;30m  ~~~~~
test.ts(1,1): error TS2304: Cannot find name 'dummy'.
```

Running 'tsc --pretty' manually from integrated terminal displays ANSI codes correctly.

data.title: Failed tsserver request should show some message in the UI
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.3.0
- OS Version: all

If a tsserver request fails we currently show an empty result. We need to investigate to make the failure more prominent.

data.title: Introduce a context for opened editors and use for "Close Editor"
data.body:
We have one action to close the active editor that closes the window if the last editor is closed. We could just introduce a new keybinding context for when editors are visible or not and reuse the existing "Close Editor" and "Close Window" actions.

Original:

<kbd>⌘W</kbd> closes documents. When no documents are open, it would then close the window. It doesn't do that any more.

data.title: Bail out of tokenization if too many states are pushed and not popped

fyi @egamma 

Follow up of #7391

The tokenizer should stop coloring a file if the rule stack is too deep.

data.title: No completion for "export default exports" modules
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.2.1
- OS Version: OS X 10.11.5

Steps to Reproduce:
1. `git clone https://gist.github.com/ithinkihaveacat/ed5fc36db488b6e5ecb209fb2d31aa68`
2. `typings install`
3. open main.ts in VSCode
4. Note that there are no completions for `$.`. (`$.greet` should be a completion.)

data.title: Search results can differ between disk match and editor match
data.body:
@sandy081 not really something that you caused, but I thought I would file this because you seem to want to look into reducing debt in search land for disk match vs. editor buffer match.

Consider you have 1 match in a file and you edit the file to remove the match. The search results nicely update live and show that you no longer have results. However, once you close the file in the editor, its associated model gets disposed and search suddenly goes back to showing the disk result, which now is outdated and still shows the match. I think the disk result needs to be updated as well when the editor changes.

Here is a video showing the issue:

![jul-04-2016 09-06-56](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/900690/16553130/ad417114-41c6-11e6-811b-481ff77254e1.gif)

data.title: [ini] Language Colorize working incorrectly for INI files

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: v1.2.1
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Change file type to INI
2. type "A=b;xxxx" in file content

Expected: "b;xxxx" colored as white
Actual: "b" in white but ";xxxx" in green

";xxxx" should only be regard as comments when there is no other contents in the line before ";"

data.title: Linux: Keybinding for "Replace in Files" conflicts
data.body: On Linux we seem to bind Ctrl+Shift+H to toggle output (https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/workbench/parts/output/browser/output.contribution.ts#L47)

data.title: It would be great if F5 would open the debug console automatically
data.body:
- VSCode Version:1.2.1
- OS Version: Windows 8.1

I am using vscode with the "Cordova Tools" extension for building an Ionic2 app. Currently my build/debug workflow is the following, when I need to debug it on the device (which I need since I am testing some hardware functionalities which cannot be simulated):
- run `ionic serve --nobrowser` in the background
- press F6 for the cordova build: this shows automatically the output window
- press F5 for starting the debugger

Here it would be nice to see the debug window automatically - without explicitely showing it with `Ctrl-Shift-Y`.

I opened an issue for this topic on [vscode-cordova repository](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-cordova/issues/161), but the guys there mentioned it seems to be more a vscode issue...

data.title: tsconfig changes to baseUrl, paths, etc require restart.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.3.0-insider, 1.2.1
- OS: Windows 10 Professional x64

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Install a nightly build of typescript supporting `baseUrl` and `paths`, anything since march should do.
2. Set `"typescript.tsdk": "C:/Users/user/AppData/Roaming/npm/node_modules/typescript/lib"`
3. Changes to paths and baseUrl are not reflected without reloading VSCode.

This is very frustrating as I am trying to determine a package install strategy which supports multi-versioned, non ambient external module resolution for jspm and I need to test changes manually. Each time I tweak any _tsconfig_ i must reload VSCode.

I was going to raise this issue with the TypeScript team but I have not been able to reproduce it in other editors, such as the VS 15 preview 2, which I have configured to use the new language service and supports these settings. I could not find any exact duplicates.

PS: Thank you for all the hard work you have put into VSCode, it keeps getting better and better :heart:

data.title: Deleting folder containing dirty files closes dirty editors
data.body: With the fix, all dirty editors should stay open and show in dirty.

data.title: docs(LanguageConfiguration): fix typo (interfaces --> interface)
HTML CSS Class Completion: Fetching info message causes lock up.
data.body:
- VSCode Version:1.3.0-insider (a2b9738a942237b59cb920940b93a0206f1b61d0)
- OS Version: Windows 10 (14376)

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open CSS file
2. When the Info message comes up for HTML CSS Class Completion.. please wait..
3. Window becomes unresponsive and the Reopen or keep waiting dialog appears
4. Pressing re-open does not kill the processes and restart VSCode
5. I have to kill all the tasks manually in task manager.

data.title: Terminal should not get first focus if visible on launch
Allow extensions to send output to the debug console.
data.body: I am building an extension/debugger combination for Clojure that uses the debug console to display the output from a continuously running REPL. I need to be able to evaluate code selected in an editor outside of the normal `Debug: evaluate` path (primarily so the extension can identify the namespace in which to execute the code). I have this working, but I would like to display the the result in the debugger  #console.
